org.spongepowered.api.entity.player

Interface Player

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Agent, ArmorEquipable, CommandSource, DataHolder, Entity, EntityState, Human, Identifiable, Living, ProjectileSource, User, Viewer

    public interface Player
extends Human, User, CommandSource, Viewer
    A Player represents the in-game entity of a human playing on a server. This is in contrast to User which represents the storage and data associated with a Player.

    Any methods called on Player that are not on User do not store any data that persists across server restarts.

      • getDisplayName

        java.lang.String getDisplayName()
        Gets the player's display name. If none set, returns their current username.
        Returns:
        The player's display name

      • getAllowFlight

        boolean getAllowFlight()
        Returns whether the Player can fly via the fly key.
        Returns:
        True if the Player is allowed to fly

        Sets if the Player can fly via the fly key.
        Parameters:
        allowFlight - True if the player is allowed to fly

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(ChatType type,
                 java.lang.String... message)
        Sends the plain text message(s) with the specified ChatType on the client.

        Use sendMessage(ChatType, Message...) for a formatted message.

        Parameters:
        type - The chat type to send the messages to
        message - The message(s) to send
